text.text: Matt Zhang said it best: “Waves is a Raspberry Pi project centered around transforming the transience of the spoken word into something concrete and physical. In our setup, a user presses a button corresponding to a question, answers it into a microphone while pressing down on the button, and then receives a receipt of the audio waveform in return. The audio waveform is also sent to a webpage, where it is displayed among the other responses that have been collected so far.”

With Waves, we were excited to explore how to encode deeply personal statements in a way that would allow them to be presented in public. We imagine that the waveform prints could be carried as sentimental keepsakes.
Waves was featured on the Raspberry Pi blog and in MagPi (p.31 - p.32), the official Raspberry Pi magazine. We presented the project live at the 2017 Segal Design Expo.
